content: To add to that, our Bitcoin mining revenue and adjusted EBITDA for last two years combined was $170 million and $77 million, respectively. With that said, though, one of the things we're keeping a very close eye on is that when Bitcoin prices move up, the price of rigs seems to move up a little quicker than Bitcoin does because everybody's moving in anticipation and worry that they're seeing in the rear view mirror, which is why we have strategically chosen and the way that we're going down its path is from a dollar cost average point of view. The fact that we saw global hash rate climb last month and then start to taper back off with the decrease in difficulty, but also how quickly we saw, it -- looking to move back up a little bit, and right now just with Bitcoin moving, another $1,000 dollars what it was averaging a few weeks ago, as it moves into the 18th.
